name: TheAtlantic
text: The "Gone Girl" author Gillian Flynn doesn’t usually write ensemble thrillers on a global scale. But with her new series "Utopia," she got to explore one of her obsessions: the conspiracy theory. @shirklesxp reports: https://t.co/WclR3uS6Ld

name: TheAtlantic
text: Companies such as Nike, Uber, and Amazon, fresh off a summer of marketing themselves on anti-racism, have found something new to usher their customers toward, writes @amandamull: the voting booth. https://t.co/4UtKhOoGP5

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"Usually debates don’t really 'matter.' Tonight’s encounter is a moment of high drama." Our staff writer @JamesFallows shares his moment-by-moment analysis of the first presidential debate. 
https://t.co/HCOCuGbXr6

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Only if the Senate performs a genuine, thorough review of the president’s nominee for a lifetime appointment to the highest court in the land, though, is this key piece of our system of checks and balances meaningful," @NoahBookbinder writes: https://t.co/JCVqARonx2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Hugh Price and his family fought for him to be one of the first Black students at an all-white high school in Washington, D.C. Once he was there, he “couldn’t wait for it to be over.” One of five pieces from our special project #TheFirsts, by @AdamHSays: https://t.co/mls4O41hgJ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @marinakoren: Trump says he has fixed “the broken military you gave me.” For more on what the president thinks about this country’s service members, read this: https://t.co/caEiIjrFYN

text: RT @yayitsrob: Trump says that rolling back the fuel-economy rules will make cars cheaper. That’s completely unsubstantiated—the math literally doesn’t work. https://t.co/n9NXk73B4o

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump launched his comeback bid with a simple, familiar strategy: bulldoze over everyone, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/47Sa9MT5ke

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Tuesday was the first presidential debate of the 2020 election, and if there is any sense or mercy left in this nation, it will be the last, too," writes @GrahamDavidA: https://t.co/MqXlLubWIc

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Biden may be faded from what he was: perhaps less crisp, less sharp, less fast. But when Biden spoke, he spoke to and about America. Trump only spoke about his wounded ego," argues @davidfrum: https://t.co/UZtZTS7XqS

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Donald Trump refused to clearly condemn white supremacy at last night’s debate. This was no accident, @emmaogreen writes: https://t.co/SeCRUkWVQi

name: TheAtlantic
text: President Trump launched his comeback bid with a simple, familiar strategy: Bulldoze over everyone, @russellberman writes: https://t.co/riXadtPqf7

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @helenlewis: This is a story about two of the dominant modes of internet culture in the 2010s - shock humour and "ironic" bigotry - and how they got us to where we are today. https://t.co/i1N7ZkWwVx

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: "In moments of direct confrontation, Trump refuses to state clearly that he condemns white supremacy," writes @emmaogreen. "White nationalists notice, and remember."

https://t.co/entilacWBZ

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @emmaogreen: Why can't he just say it?

Trump equivocates about white supremacy on the presidential debate stage:

https://t.co/10cO5kGGwV

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "If Trump wants chaos, he may be in luck. On the social-media platform Telegram last night, the Proud Boys posted a photoshopped version of their logo surrounded by the words 'stand back' and 'stand by.'" 
-- @emmaogreen:
https://t.co/DDZ3PLeyNj

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @gcaw: Everyone claims to believe that democracy is important. Matthew Graham & Milan Svolik, Yale political scientists, tried to figure out how many voters *really* care about democracy. The answer was shockingly low: 3.5 percent https://t.co/nV587GAd1P

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: I wrote about America's growing vote-by-mail controversies:

- What's the truth behind Trump's claims of mass fraud? 
- Why have so many mail ballots been rejected in 2020?
- Is voting in person safer than we thought?
- How should I vote?

https://t.co/qmSJxnOjrO

name: TheAtlantic
text: "As selfish as I worried dating was, the value of a joyful day had shot up in quarantine, and Sam gave me so many—did that count for nothing?" @ginnyhogan_ writes about what it's like to start a new relationship during the pandemic: https://t.co/oc57m6FcX5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Interruption is such a familiar form of disrespect, @megangarber writes. During the presidential debate, viewers watched its dynamics in real time: https://t.co/hOBHozJ9BV

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: “What seemed to be fun and funny ended up functioning as a Trojan horse for white-supremacist, violent ideologies to shuffle through the gates and not be recognized.” https://t.co/KPSpOOutlR

name: TheAtlantic
text: SPONSORED: Everyone needs to get outside sometimes—including John Mayer. A few months ago, we sent him to Jedediah Smith Redwoods State Park in his favorite vehicle: the new @LandroverUSA Defender 110. See the full journey here: https://t.co/ptXnpkwGeP https://t.co/IRb6uw3aZ3

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The past few months have complicated the idea that voting in person is risky—or that voting by mail is entirely risk-free," @DKThomp writes: https://t.co/H3JfZ7XRV4
